Dec 23 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories on the New York Times business pages. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- Facebook's parent company Meta Platforms Inc FB.O is aiming for "deep compatibility" with blockchain technology, according to an internal post sent to employees on Tuesday by Andrew Bosworth, who will become the company's chief technology officer next year. https://nyti.ms/33SrXo9


- Labor organizers at an Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O warehouse on Staten Island in U.S. said on Wednesday they had submitted more than 2,500 worker signatures to the National Labor Relations Board in a petition to hold a union election. https://nyti.ms/32pyvtE


- The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday authorized the first pill for COVID-19 treatment, offering a highly effective defense against severe illness as the country endures another major surge of the pandemic. The drug, developed by Pfizer Inc PFE.N and known as Paxlovid, is authorized for COVID-19 patients age 12 and over who are vulnerable to becoming severely ill. https://nyti.ms/3yRS360


- The U.S. federal government’s main auto safety regulator said on Wednesday that it had opened an investigation into a feature in cars made by Tesla Inc TSLA.O that allows drivers to play games on a dashboard touch screen while the car is in motion. https://nyti.ms/30Rc7sE


- Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O reinstated a mask mandate for all employees in its U.S. warehouses starting on Wednesday, as the Omicron variant of COVID-19 spreads nationwide and the company makes a final shipping push before Christmas. https://nyti.ms/3stM4Dt


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)
